description.text: "Molar Energy" is the total energy contained by a thermodynamic system. The unit is $$J/mol$$, also expressed as $$joule/mole$$,  or $$joules per mole$$. This unit is commonly used in the SI unit system. The quantity has the dimension of $$M \cdot L^2 \cdot  T^{-2} \cdot N^{-1}$$ where $$M$$ is mass, $$L$$ is length, $$T$$ is time, and $$N$$ is amount of substance.
